@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a new possible transition from one state to another.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The name of this transition

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The predicate function for this transition.  This is documented in the
constructor, and is typically provided through the constructor's
transitionInfo object, but it is also possible (but highly NOT
recommended) to change this dynamically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The state to transition to, if the predicate determines that this
transition is acceptable.  This is documented in the constructor, and
is typically provided through the constructor's transitionInfo object,
but it is also possible (but highly NOT recommended) to change this
dynamically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Automatic actions to take prior to calling the transition's
ontransition function.  This is documented in the constructor, and is
typically provided through the constructor's transitionInfo object, but
it is also possible (but highly NOT recommended) to change this
dynamically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Automatic actions to take immediately after calling the transition's
ontransition function.  This is documented in the constructor, and is
typically provided through the constructor's transitionInfo object, but
it is also possible (but highly NOT recommended) to change this
dynamically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The function run when the transition is accepted.  This is documented
in the constructor, and is typically provided through the constructor's
transitionInfo object, but it is also possible (but highly NOT
recommended) to change this dynamically.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Validate the predicate. Converts all incoming values to functions.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal transform method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal transform method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal transform method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal transform method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If given a function, bind it to a specified context.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
f {Function|var}
  The (possibly) function to be bound to the specified context.
@param.description: The (possibly) function to be bound to the specified context.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {Object}
  The context to bind the function to.
@param.description: The context to bind the function to.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Function}
  If f was a function, the return value is f wrapped such that it will
  be called in the specified context. Otherwise, f is returned
  unaltered.
@return.description:
If f was a function, the return value is f wrapped such that it will
  be called in the specified context. Otherwise, f is returned
  unaltered.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property name. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #name}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property name. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #name}.
